tool.name: Perform 2-D spot detection

param.name: fn_in
param.label: Intensity image or a stack of images

param.name: frame_1st
param.label: Starting time point (1 for the first frame of the stack)

param.name: frame_end
param.label: Ending time point (0 for the last frame of the stack)

param.name: abs_threshold
param.label: Minimum filter response (absolute)
param.help: Filter responses below this threshold will be ignored. Only filter responses above this thresholding will be considered as blobs. This threshold is ignored if the relative threshold (below) corresponds to a higher response.

param.name: rel_threshold
param.label: Minimum filter response (relative)
param.help: Same as the absolute threshold (above), but as a fraction of the overall maximum filter response of an image. This threshold is ignored if it corresponds to a response below the absolute threshold.

param.name: boundary
param.label: Image boundary
param.help: Width of image boundaries (in pixel) where spots will be ignored.

tool.help:
**Perform spot detection and measure the image intensities.**
This tool detects spots (blobs) and measures the image intensities in a single-channel 2-D image (or a stack of such images).
The tool produces a TSV file containing all detections, with the following columns:
- ``frame``: The frame of the image stack - ``pos_x``: The horizontal coordinate of the detection - ``pos_y``: The vertical coordinate of the detection - ``scale``: The scale at which the detection was found - ``radius``: The radius of the detected spot - ``intensity``: The mean intensity of the spot
